node.caption:
Pecan Pie Cheesecake w/ Dulce de Leche: I know I‚Äôm a few days late to #thanksgivingdessert content and have been a little quiet on here, but I wanted to share this cheesecake that I made for a friendsgiving last week hosted by some lovely friends in NYC.  This is a pecan pie cheesecake swirled with dulce de leche. When I saw @studiobaked post the recipe for this on her feed I instantly knew I had to make it. We had a signup sheet for this friendsgiving and pie was already accounted for, so this was perfect.  I was told it was the best cheesecake they‚Äôve ever had by multiple people, so folks this is a keeper. The cheesecake was oh so creamy and perfectly complemented the pecan topping and graham cracker pecan crust. üßÄüç∞
.
.

Raspberry Apricot Scones: Happy LDW! I‚Äôm taking it easy this holiday weekend, catching up on sleep, friends and books I got to finish for bookclub üò¨ These scones are a perfect way to start a lazy Sunday morning.  The recipe is @kingarthurflour ‚Äôs master scone recipe with 1 cup of Raspberry jammy bits (also from KAF!) and 1 cup of chopped dried apricots mixed in.  I am a big fan of their jammy bits (and I love saying it outloud), since they are basically fruit puree + sugar and melt a bit during baking, giving the scones a little bit of jam in every bite! .
I also made some fig jam to accompany these scones, and they were **chefs kiss** together
.
.

Dulce de Leche Stuffed Chocolate Chunk Cookies: These cookies are a creation of my attempt to use up the multiple jars of dulce de leche my brother graciously brought back for me from his trip to Argentina.  He had some time off while switching jobs.  He is now is at his new fancy hedge fund job and I‚Äôm such a proud older sis! It was also conveniently his birthday, so most of these cookies went to him since he is a CCC fiend. .
These are a modified recipe of mine, which will be up on fullstackkithen.com soon! They have a mix of milk and dark chocolate @gittard discs, flakey salt on top and a healthy dollop of dulce inside, which spreads along with the cookie to create a thin layer of dulce throughout ü§üüèª
.
.
.

Rhubarb Almond Frangipane Tart w/ Cherry Rhubarb Jam: I know rhubarb season is almost over, but I just needed to buy some when I saw a full table of it at the farmers market a little while back. This tart has a flakey shortbread crust, a sweet rich almond frangipane (frangipane is  basically made up of flour + almonds + eggs + sugar + butter), strips of bright red and green rhubarb, and brushed with homemade cherry rhubarb jam! Rhubarb is one of those ingredients that always gets me so excited whenever I see it at the markets, and I‚Äôm always sad when the season is over.  So make the most of summer! .
Recipe for this tart is from @theflouredtable (search rhubarb frangipane tart) - I had to use up some cherries so I made the jam (basically 2/3 cherries, 1/3 rhubarb + sugar + lemon cooked down) that I brushed on top. Turned out great and I have more jam for a different project! 
#frangipanetart #frangipane #rhubarbtart #cherryjam #tart #cherryrhubarb #rhubarbseason #rhubarb #thesugarfiles #fruittart #bakersofinstagram  @flatlaytoday #flaylaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #wsbakeclub #foodtographyschool #foodiefeature #kingarthorflour  #bakefromscratch #nycbaker

Carrot Coconut Cake w/ Honey Cream Cheese Frosting: I made this cake a few weeks ago for one of my closest friends and overall awesome person @iamdopico ‚Äôs birthday.  She always tells me she doesn‚Äôt eat sweets (its a shock we‚Äôre still friends) except for my baked goods. I guess I should be flattered üòè So therefore for her birthday I decided on a carrot cake, cutting the sugar a bit and used a cream cheese frosting that is solely sweetened with honey. The sunflowers were fun to make and I tried to go for those Van Gough vibes.
.
Carrot cake is a combo of @testkitchen and @livforcake ‚Äôs recipes for carrot cake (with some added coconut ü••ü§üüèª) Honey cream cheese frosting is from America‚Äôs test kitchen as well. The flowers are made with plain ol‚Äô american buttercream in order to keep their shape.
.
.
.

Throwing it back this Thursday to some of the finished goods I made in a 3 day laminating class I took with my mom a few weeks ago at the King Arthur Flour baking school in Vermont. ü•ê Im starting to look into bike routes for when I go back to Vermont next weekend with my Dad and craving these croissants that are loooong gone.  Seriously though, Vermont has all of my favorite things - baking, biking, beer, bomb ass cheese, beautiful hikes.. .
Surprisingly the process of laminating dough (the act of creating layers of dough and butter that create flakey pastries) was a lot easier than expected, just a lot of waiting times between rolling/folding.  These came out perfect, but I was under guidance of amazing teachers who also knew exactly when to pull them out of the oven. I am excited to try it on my own soon, but may have to wait for the temp to cool so it doesn‚Äôt turn into a pool of butter ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è If you missed my instagram stories of the class, they can be found in the highlights!
.
#kingarthurflour #kingarthurbakingschool #croissants #croissant #painauchocolat #frenchpastry #vienoiserie  #croissantlover #bakersofinstagram  #summerbaking #laminateddough #kingarthurflourrecipe @flatlaytoday #flaylaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking  #wsbakeclub #foodiefeature #bakefromscratch #pastryaddict

Bake Sale Raspberry Macarons : My office had a bake sale today to benefit Breast Cancer Awareness Month (all of October) and I made these lil pink macarons as my contribution to the sale.  In total we raised almost $1000 for the @suzangkomen foundation! (these alone made $100+ of that üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è) All of the baked goods looked great and the ones I tried were so delicious! It was awesome seeing people lined up to buy treats, with most of them gone within an hour. -- I also made a donation to @bcrfcure today and encourage anyone who sees this to donate directly to any of the foundations that fund breast cancer research or provide services/resources.  Theres still half the month left so get to it! Swipe to see some of the goods other people brought!
.
I added 10g of ground freeze-dried raspberries, replacing some of the powdered sugar in a vanilla macaron shell recipe.  The buttercream is a german buttercream with rose water + raspberry extract. Base shell recipe from @cloudykitchen & @foxandcrane .
.
#macarons #frenchmacarons #breastcancerawareness #breastcancerawarenessmonth #groupninemedia #frenchdesserts #macaronlove #rosemacarons #rose #raspberry #macaronstagram  #macaronlady #bakersofinstagram @flatlaytoday #flaylaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking @thrillist  #foodtographyschool #foodiefeature #bobsredmill #bakefromscratch #nycbaker

Apple Galette w/ Vermont Maple Syrup üçé ü•ê: My mom and I are currently on our third and last day of a ‚ÄúLaminating Pastry Intensive Workshop‚Äù at @kingarthurflour ‚Äòs baking school in Norwich, VT. I‚Äôve done a few classes here before, but I‚Äôm constantly impressed every time. Their cafe, school and shop (which is a great exercise in practicing self control) are all awesome. I‚Äôve been posting snippets from the class on my stories and they will be in the highlights ü§ôüèº
.
The first day we learned how to make a blitz (rough) puff and prepped all the dough for various pastries. A blitz puff uses flattened cubes of butter folded in instead of a sheet of butter, then a few folds all at once to mimic a puff pastry. This Apple galette uses said blitz pastry and was brushed with maple syrup üçÅ right out of the oven ü§§ Second photo were turnovers using the blitz that we stuffed with tomato sauce, caramelized onions and spinach. 
#kingarthurflour #kingarthurbakingschool #galette #puffpastry #applegalette #applepie #blitzpuff #roughpuff #bakersofinstagram  #apples #summerbaking #kingarthurflourrecipe @flatlaytoday #flaylaytoday #foodstyling #feedfeed @thefeedfeed #huffposttaste @thefeedfeed.baking #f52grams @food52 #thebakefeed #bakefromscratch #buzzfeedfood @saveurmag #foodphotography #beautifulcuisines @beautifulcuisines #bakestagram #feedfeedbaking  #wsbakeclub #foodiefeature #bakefromscratch #nycbaker

Buckeye Balls ‚ú®: I recently joined a group of friends who were doing a monthly bookclub and it was finally my turn to host last week! I chose the book ‚ÄòLittle Fires Everywhere‚Äô by @pronounced_ing which I tremendously enjoyed.  It was overall an easy and enjoyable read with a bunch of interesting themes for us to talk about üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I think its gonna make a great TV adaptation, coming to @hulu soon. Well the story takes place in Shaker Heights Ohio, and these sugary indulgent balls are a true Ohio staple. I glitzed them up with some sprinkles and @wiltoncakes gold spray ! I served alongside a ton of cheese, crackers and beet goat cheese hummus ü§ôüèº
.
 If you‚Äôve read Little Fires Everywhere what did you think of it?!
.
Buckeye Balls - makes ~ 30
1 container (1.5 cups) of peanut butter
4 cups of powdered sugar
1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp cinnamon
1/2 cup of butter
8 oz dark chocolate
1 Tbsp shortening or coconut oil
Sprinkles
.
Combine first 5 ingredients in a bowl. Using a 2 tsp cookie scoop, create balls and place on a sheet pan lined with wax/parchment paper. Refrigerate for 30 min. Using a double broiler or microwave, melt chocolate and shortening until smooth.  Using a toothpick, dip each ball into the chocolate and return to pan. Add sprinkles. Refrigerate another 30 min and enjoy!
.

Fig and Cherry Plum Galette: I cant believe it‚Äôs only just Tuesday üòí I spent most of the day trying to remember how Java works (the programming language) since I‚Äôve been mostly writing in JavaScript (and Python) the past few years at my job. It was a real struggle trying to remember how types work and it gave me not so great flashbacks to my college Computer Science classes. At least I have some of this galette left at home to try and block any further trips down memory of all the all-nighters I had to pull. This galette is not too sweet, super easy to make and is perfect for any time of day ü§ôüèº
.
To make it, slice figs and @traderjoes cherry plums and toss with ¬Ω tsp vanilla, 1 tsp lemon juice, 3 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp cornstarch and let sit for 10 min. I pulled out some pie dough from the freezer, recipe from @birdsblack - rolled out to a circle 1/8th of an inch. Arrange fruit on dough and fold in the dough on all sides. Refrigerate for 30 min.  Brush sides with egg wash and sprinkle sparkling sugar. bake at 375 for 35-40 or until golden. .
.

Dulce de Leche Stuffed Chocolate Chunk Cookies (Baked + recipe): These babies have a mix of milk and dark chocolate @guittardchocolate discs, flaky salt on top and a healthy dollop of dulce de leche inside ü§üüèª what more can you ask for out of this Tuesday? .
The recipe is up on full stack kitchen! https://www.fullstackkitchen.com/dulce-de-leche-chocolate-chunk-cookies/ . 
The name of the blog is a play on the fact that I‚Äôm a full stack developer / engineer and am going to be working on adding cool features to the blog as i grow it. 
I‚Äôve been starting to post my recipes on it, but it still very much is a work in progress!  I finally got the url issues fixed and happy with the way I deploy the site to production! (just 1 terminal command that updates a static site branch on GitHub that updates the site) and then there was also a whole thing with someone asking me out on GitHub using the codebase that hosts this blog üôÑ guess comes with the territory. Cookies make things better is the moral of the story. .
.
.

Pecan Brittle Bark Cookies:  Holiday baking is in full effect in my apartment, and these babies are making an appearance.  The recipe is a little involved - you make hard pecan caramel that gets broken up and made into a dark chocolate caramel bark.  The bark is then used instead of chocolate chips in the cookie recipe.  It so good, the flavors are so much more elevated than a typical CCC, and the brown sugar/oil ratios give it a really soft but perfect texture when you bite into it. Recipe is from #thecookiebook by @displacedhousewife ! .
Im planning on staying in NYC for the holidays, but going to spend Christmas with my good friend in the suburbs, so the next few days will be filled with preparing the most epic of cookie containers for her family.  Im super looking forward to it.  Cookies are the best gifts you can give üç™üíå
.
.
